title: How to get the transferred learning?
body:
Hey there,

I'm using DLC 2.0 in windows 10, Anaconda env, and running on COLAB.
I've been training a model with a single animal, identifying 2 points (snout and tail base). For the analyzed videos with a single animal is working quite nicely.

After re-reading the paper to be sure, I tried to analyze videos with two animals, expecting to get the selected points on both animals by the transferred learning. However, what I get is the single 2 points that split between the animals, so for example, in some frames the nose is in animal A, in the next ones it jumps to animal B and so on. 

My question/problem is that I don't really know if I need to modify something in the .yaml files in order to generalize to multiple animals (I thought I might needed to duplicate the bodyparts in the config yaml depending on the number of animals or something else). Or it just might be that the model needs more training. 

So another question popping up is if it is better to try training a single animal model, for later analyzing videos with multiple animals, or in the other hand, it is better to train the model with videos containing multiple animals and the label all the desired points (animal1_nose, animal2_nose, animal1_tailbase, animal2_tailbase...).

Any feedback wil be much appreaciated,

BR
